Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien
The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide

wikitext.*:
On [[28 July]] [[1955]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to Jennifer Brookes-Smith''' (name also given as "Jennifer Paxman").<ref name=TB/><ref name=CG>{{CG|C}}, p. 462</ref>

*'''Subject(s):''' Replying to a letter written in March, Tolkien apologises for having been busy.<ref name=CG/> Among the subjects Tolkien discusses in the letter are the production of the Appendices and map for ''[[The Return of the King]]'' and an impending trip to [[Gondor]]: [[Pelargir]] and [[Lossarnach]] - identified as Italy: Venice and Assisi.<ref name=TB>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=72430|articlename=20th-Century Books and Manuscripts. 2003|dated=|website=TB|accessed=9 April 2014}}</ref>
*'''Description:''' Two pages.<ref name=TB/>
*'''Publication:''' A description of the letter appeared in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide|The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''. Extracts from the letter were reproduced in ''[[Christie's 20th Century Books and Manuscripts 2 December 2003]]''.
